newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan prosecutors raid Nomura headquarters.
newsitem.headline: Japan prosecutors raid Nomura headquarters.

text.p: Tokyo prosecutors on Friday raided the headquarters of scandal-hit Nomura Securities Co Ltd and the house of former Nomura president Hideo Sakamaki, Jiji news agency reported.
A Nomura Securities spokesman confirmed that the firm's head offices were raided by prosecutors, but he said he had no information about the reported raid on Sakamaki's house.
Tokyo prosecutors earlier on Friday arrested Sakamaki in connection with a widening scandal over payoffs to a racketeer.

Prosecutors said in a statement that Sakamaki, who stepped down as president in March over the scandal, was suspected of violating the Commercial Code and the Securities and Exchange Law by conspiring with three Nomura executives to pay 38.5 million yen ($331,000) to Ryuichi Koike, the "sokaiya" corporate racketeer at the heart of the affair, in 1995.
